feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued February 05 at 7:53AM AKST until February 06 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 3 PM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph near White Pass resulting in local blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Haines and Klondike Highways.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 05 at 6:17AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY RAIN RETURNS FOR SATURDAY EVENING INTO SUNDAY... A quick moving moisture-laden front will move into the panhandle Saturday afternoon. 1 to 3 inches of rain are expected near sea level over the next 48 hours. Higher rain amounts are possible on windward slopes of the terrain.

entry.summary: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY RAIN EXPECTED TO FALL ON SNOWPACK SATURDAY EVENING INTO SUNDAY... A quick moving moisture-laden front will move into the panhandle Saturday afternoon. 1 to 3 inches of rain is expected over the next 48 hours, falling on top of the recent addition to the snow pack. entry.title: Wind Chill Warning issued February 05 at 3:09AM AKST until February 07 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills expected. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 50 below zero to 65 below zero.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 04 at 6:38PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Black Ice Formation Through Saturday Morning Hours... Residual moisture potential on area roadways, especially secondary ones, continues. With temperatures expected to remain below freezing through morning hours on Saturday, patchy black ice across area roadways will continue. This could lead to treacherous travel conditions through morning hours on Saturday.
